intro: Telipogon hausmannianus, commonly known as the Hausmann's grass, is a rare and specialized plant species belonging to the Poaceae family. It is native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes in South America, where it thrives in cool, moist environments. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with narrow, elongated leaves. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in spikelets. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Telipogon hausmannianus is considered a vulnerable species.
